info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 4:02AM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. * WHERE...Hardin, Southern Jasper and Southern Newton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon to 6 PM CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to 9 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Visit www.drivetexas.org for road information.
